gurmukhi: Air sYn jbY Gin ijau aumifE pun sRI biRjnwQ icqY ihq jwnXo ] Aaur BUmwsur BUm ko bwrk BUpq hY ien kau pihcwnXo ]
transliteration: Ar(i) Sain Jabai Ghan(i) Jio Oumdio Poun Sribrijnaath Chitai Hit Jaanyo|| Aur Bhoomaasur Bhoom Ko Baarak Bhoopat Hai In Kau Paihchaanyo||
translation: When the enemy’s army rushed forth like clouds, then Krishna thought in his mind and recognized Bhumasura, the son of the earth;

gurmukhi: mwnhu AMq smY inD nIr hIAY aumfXo kib sXwm bKwnXo ] sXwm jU hyr iqno Apno icq BIqr nYk nhI frpwnXo ]2132]
transliteration: Maanoh Ant Samai Nidh Neer Heeai Oumdyo Kabi Syaam Bakhaanyo|| Syaam Joo Her Tino Apno Chit Bheetar Naik Nahidarpaanyo||2132||
translation: It appeared that on the doomsday the ocean was surging forth, but Krishna did not fear even slightly on seeing Bhumasura.2132.

gurmukhi: Air puMj gieMdn mY Dnu qwih lsY sB hI ijh lok Ptw ] bk ko ijn kop ibnws kIAw mur ko iCn mY ijh mUMf ktw ]
transliteration: Ar(i) Pounj Gadindan Mai Dhan(u) Taah(i) Lasai Sabh Hijih Lok Phadaa|| Bak Ko Jin Kop Binaas Keeaa Mur Ko Chhin Mai Jih Moondd Kataa||
translation: Amongst the gathering of elephants of the enemy’s army, Krishna looked splendid like the bow of Indra; Krishna had also destroyed Bakasura and chopped the head of Mur in an instant:

gurmukhi: md m`iq krI dl Awvq Xo ijm jor kY Awvq myG Gtw ] iqn mY Dnu sXwm kI XO cmkY ijm ABRn BIqr ib`j Ctw ]2133]
transliteration: Mad Matt(i) Karidal Aavat Yo Jim Jor Kai Aavat Megh Ghataa|| Tin Mai Dhan(u) Syaam Kiyou Chamkai Jim Abhran Bheetar Bijj Chhataa||2133||
translation: From the frontal side, the group of elephants was rushing forth like the clouds and wihting them the bow of Krishna was shining like lightning among the clouds.2133.

gurmukhi: bhu ckR ky sMg hny Btvw bhuqy pRB Dwie cpytn mwry ] eyk gdw hI so Dwie hny igr BUm pry bhuro n sMBwry ]
transliteration: Bahu Chakra Ke San Hane Bhatvaa Prabh Dhaae Chappetan Mdare|| Ek Gadaa Hiso Dhaae Chapetan Mdare|| Ek Gadaa Hiso Dhaae Hane Gir Bhoom Dare Bahuro Na Sanbhdare||
translation: He killed many warriors with his discus and many other by direct blows; many were killed with the mace and thrown down on the ground and they could not control themselves again;

gurmukhi: eyk kty krvwrn so AD bIc qy hoie pry Bt inAwry ] mwno qKwnn kwnn mY kit kY krvqRx so dRum fwry ]2134]
transliteration: Ek Kate Karvaaran So Adh Beech Te Hoe Dare Bhat Nidare|| Maano Takhaanan Kaanan Mai Kattee Karvatran So Droum Ddare||2134||
translation: Many warriors were chopped into half with the sword and were lying down like the trees chopped by the carpenter in the forest.2134.

gurmukhi: eyk pry Bt jUJ Drw iek dyK dSw iqh swmuih Dwey ] nYk n qRws Dry icq mY kib sXwm BnY nhI qRws bxwey ]
transliteration: Ek Dare Bhat Joojh Dharaa Ik Dekh Dashaa Tih Saamuh(i) Dhaae|| Naik Na Traas Ddare Chit Mai Kabi Syaam Bhanai Nahitraas Banaae||
translation: Some warriors were dead and lying down on the earth and many warrior seeing their such plight came forward; they were all completely fearless and placing their shield before their faces,

gurmukhi: dY muK Fwl lIey krvwr inSMk dY sXwm ky aUpr Awey ] qy sr eyk hI so pRB jU hn AMqk ky pur bIc pTwey ]2135]
transliteration: Dai Moukh Dhaal Leee Karvaar Nishank Dai Syaamke Oopar Aae|| Te Sar Ek Hiso Prabh Joo Han Antak Ke Pur Beech Pathaae||2135||
translation: And taking their swords in their hands, they fell upon Krishna; only with a single arrow Krishna despatched them all to the abode of Yama.2135.

gurmukhi: sRI jdubIr jbY irs so sB hI Btvw jmlok pTwey ] Aaur ijq Bt jIq bcy ien dyK dSw fir kY su prwey ]
transliteration: Srijadoubeer Jabai Ris So Sabh Hibhatvaa Jamlok Pathaae|| Aur Jite Bhat Jeet Bache In Dekh Dashaa Dar(i) Kai Su Paraae||
translation: When in his fury, Krishna killed all the warriors and those who had survived, seeing such a situation, fled away;

gurmukhi: jy hir aUpir Dwie gey bDby khu qy iPr jIqn Awey ] AYso auGwie kY sIs Furwie kY Awpih BUpq ju`D kO Dwey ]2136]
transliteration: Je Har(i) Oopar(i) Dhaae Gad Badh Be Kauh Te Phir Jeetan Aae Aiso Oughaae Kai Sees Dhuraae Kai Aapah(i) Bhoopat Juddh Kau Dhaae||2136||
translation: Those who fell upon Krishna in order to kill him, they could not return alive; in this way, in various groups, and moving their heads, the king went to wage war.2136.
